 29 -class VirtualTimer(object): 

 30      """ 
 31      A virtual timer multiplexed to a hardware timer. 
 32   
 33      Implements the same interface as L{Timer}. 
 34   
 35      @ivar callback: Function to be called when timer fires. 
 36      """ 

 37 -    def __init__(self, mux, callback=None): 

 38          """ 
 39          Create virtual timer. 
 40   
 41          @param mux: The L{TimerMultiplexer} implementing this timer. 
 42          """ 
 43          self._period = None 
 44          self._mux = mux 
 45          self.callback = callback 
 46          self._mux._vtimers.append(self) 

 47   
 48      @prepend_method_doc(Timer) 

 49 -    def start(self, period, repeat=False): 

 50          self._period = period 
 51          self._repeat = repeat 
 52   
 53          if self._mux._inHandler: 
 54              # In timer event, handler is iterating through virtual timer list. 
 55              self._done = True 
 56              self._remaining = self._period 
 57          else: 
 58              self._done = False 
 59              if self._mux._period is None: 
 60                  # Timer off, this will become the only active virtual timer. 
 61                  self._remaining = self._period 
 62                  self._mux._period = self._period 
 63                  self._mux._timer.start(self._period, self._mux._timerHandler) 
 64              elif self._period < self._mux._period: 
 65                  # This timer will fire before any others. 
 66                  self._remaining = self._period 
 67                  elapsed = self._mux._timer.timeElapsed() 
 68                  for vtimer in self._mux._vtimers: 
 69                      if vtimer is not self and vtimer._period is not None: 
 70                          vtimer._remaining -= elapsed 
 71                  self._mux._period = self._period 
 72                  self._mux._timer.start(self._mux._period, 
 73                          self._mux._timerHandler) 
 74              elif self._period == self._mux._period: 
 75                  # This timer will fire at the same time as others. 
 76                  self._remaining = self._period 
 77              else: 
 78                  # Other timers will fire before this one. 
 79                  self._remaining = self._period + self._mux._timer.timeElapsed() 

 80   
 81      @prepend_method_doc(Timer) 

 82 -    def clear(self): 

 83          self._period = None 

 84   
 85      @prepend_method_doc(Timer) 

 86 -    def timeElapsed(self): 

 87          return (self._period - self._remaining) + self.mux._timer.timeElapsed()

 89 -class TimerMultiplexer(object): 

 90      """ 
 91      Multiplexer for running multiple virtual timers on one hardware timer. 
 92      """ 
 93   
 94      __metaclass__ = ABCMeta 
 95   

 96 -    def __init__(self, timer): 

 97          """ 
 98          Create timer multiplexer. 
 99   
100          @param timer: L{Timer} to multiplex. 
101          """ 
102          self._timer = timer 
103          self._vtimers = [] 
104          self._period = None 
105          self._inHandler = False 
106          timer.clear() 
107          timer.callback = self._timerHandler 

108   

109 -    def _timerHandler(self): 

110          """ 
111          Timer event handler. 
112          """ 
113   
114          self._inHandler = True 
115          for vtimer in self._vtimers: 
116              if vtimer._period is not None and not vtimer._done: 
117                  vtimer._remaining -= self._period 
118                  if vtimer._remaining <= 0: 
119                      if vtimer._repeat: 
120                          vtimer._remaining = vtimer._period 
121                      else: 
122                          vtimer._period = None 
123                      if vtimer.callback is not None: 
124                          vtimer.callback() 
125          self._inHandler = False 
126   
127          for vtimer in self._vtimers: 
128              vtimer._done = False 
129   
130          waits = [vtimer._remaining for vtimer in self._vtimers 
131                  if vtimer._period is not None] 
132   
133          if len(waits) > 0: 
134              self._period = min(waits) 
135              self._timer.start(self._period, self._timerHandler) 
136          else: 
137              self._period = None
